text: Typically, when things seem too good to be
true, I reject the proposition altogether.
Well, thank you for the latitude.
You have the controlling interest in Schwartz
and Meyer. Yes. You're offering it for sale?
Correct. And all you want is to carve out
the real estate funds.
Just the real estate.
You will continue managing the real estate
funds. It's a little over 28,000 acres.
That's what I mean. Beth is too good to be
true. Schwartz and Meyer manages $2.3
billion with an average return of 22%.
That's a net of 480 million per year.
And you're giving it away.
Well, I'm keeping $300 million worth of real
estate. I'd hardly call that giving it away.
That land will nosedive.
Now that Emmy's airport's been shut down.
Well, that's my problem.
There's a rattlesnake somewhere in this deal,
Beth. Care to point it out?
Can we have some privacy.
Give us a
minute.
Care for one?
Roh? I have seen you snort cocaine off a
stripper stomach.
Why not?
Emmy is going to sue me.
They're going to claim they fired me for
cause. And that my severance should be
nullified by me violating their company's
NDA. Then they're going to sue me for my
peace in this place.
Saying that I negotiated in bad faith.
Therefore, the ownership agreement for
Schwartz and Meyer should also be nullified.
Then they're going to sue the state for
breach of contract and seek to initiate
eminent domain in federal court.
All those things seem likely.
No sh*t.
Market equities is your largest competitor,
right? Yes.
Don't you want to f*** them over just a
little bit?
Yeah.
I want to f*** them over a lot.
Just don't want to get f***** in the
process.
Well, I will place the land in a conservation
easement. Okay.
Since this is the land they intended to
build terminal two, their development is
done no matter what a f****** federal judge
says. They will write down a billion in
losses and 20 times that in lost revenue
over the next ten years.
I still control this place so I can still
sell it. And when I do, there is not a court
in this country that can give it back.
It's another 2 billion off their balance
sheet and that is how CEOs get fired.
There is zero risk to you.
You will inherit 12 pipe hitting investment
bankers, generating half a billion in
profits and 40 million in your pocket every
f****** year. And it didn't cost you a dime.
Where is the rattlesnake in the deal?
I am the rattlesnake.
But you're not who I'm going to bite.
All right, Beth, I'll take it to the board.
You don't need the board's approval.
You're not spending any money.
This is a one day only offer.
Okay. I'm on a clock.
I may be one step ahead of him, but I am not
two.
Can my attorney look that over?
Sure. Why not?
Nothing f**** up a great deal like a good
attorney. You're a big boy, Rob.
You can trust me on this.
And you know it.
You better watch out, Beth.
They might send a hitman after you for this.
After this, the hitman will be after them.
I assume you'll be issuing a press release.
You bet your f****** a** I am.
